cyclone.name: SALLY
cyclone.current_location: about 50 miles ESE of Miami, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Crossing south Florida tonight, then moving northwestward across the east-central Gulf toward the north-central Gulf Coast (Louisiana/Mississippi) early next week

weather_observation.watch_coast: South of Jupiter Inlet to north of Ocean Reef, FL (Atlantic side)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire northern Gulf Coast from southeast Louisiana eastward through Mississippi, Alabama and Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (gusts 40–50 mph) possible Tuesday into early Wednesday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Onshore flow could push water levels 3–5 ft above ground in southeast Louisiana bays and tidal lakes
weather_observation.rainfall: Potential 4–8 inches with locally higher totals, producing flash and river flooding along the lower Mississippi River corridor
weather_observation.other_hazards: Possible river level rises and restricted vessel traffic on the Mississippi River channel due to high water and strong currents
